trans-unit.source: Specifies when you can use a licensed object and provides a way of obtaining additional services needed to support licenses running within its domain.
This class provides the default LicenseContext.
It implements only run-time support and does not support saved license keys.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, returns a saved license key for the specified type, from the specified resource assembly.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type of component.
An <xref:System.Reflection.Assembly> with the license key.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.License.LicenseKey*> for the specified type.
This method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> unless you override it.
Gets the requested service, if it is available.
The type of service to retrieve.
An instance of the service, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the service cannot be found.
When overridden in a derived class, sets a license key for the specified type.
Typically, call this method when you set <xref:System.ComponentModel.LicenseUsageMode> at design time.
You must override the <xref:System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext.UsageMode%2A> property to implement design-time license support.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the component associated with the license key.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.License.LicenseKey*> to save for the type of component.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that specifies when you can use a license.
One of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.LicenseUsageMode"></xref> values that specifies when you can use a license.
The default is <xref href="System.ComponentModel.LicenseUsageMode"></xref>.
